PSSI Sebut Timnas Indonesia Punya Pelatih Baru November Ini
06 Nov 2019, 08:20 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ketua Umum PSSI, Mochamad Iriawan, memastikan Pelatih Timnas Indonesia, Simon McMenemy, bakal diganti sesuai dengan hasil rapat Komite Eksekutif (Exco). Mantan Kapolda Metro Jaya ini mengatakan masih ada prosedur administasi yang perlu dilewati sehingga pelatih asal Skotlandia itu bisa diputus kontraknya.
"Tentunya ada tata cara atau prosedur yang harus dilalui," kata pria yang akrab disapa Iwan Bule ini di Hotel Sultan, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Untuk calon pengganti, kata Iwan Bule, ada dua nama yang menguat yakni Luis Milla dan pelatih asal Korea Selatan, Shin Tae-yong. Selain itu ada beberapa nama pelatih nasional yang diusulkan ke pengurus ke PSSI. "Nanti mereka baru bisa akhir bulan November karena mereka terkait pekerjaan yang sudah ada yang mereka lakukan," kata dia.
Komite Eksekutif PSSI memutuskan untuk mengganti pelatih Timnas Indonesia, Simon McMenemy. Pergantian tersebut disampaikan langsung oleh Ketua PSSI, Mochamad Iriawan, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
“Kami mengucapkan terima kasih kepada Simon atas kerja sama selama ini. Semoga laga melawan Malaysia kita mendapatkan hasil yang positif,” kata dia.
Laga kedua Timnas Indonesia melawan Malaysia di Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022 akan menjadi pertandingan terakhir bagi Simon. Federasi saat ini tengah mencari pengganti Simon. Komite Eksekutif akan mendengarkan masukan dari Departemen Teknik PSSI.
Selain itu, federasi juga akan mengundang dan menyerap aspirasi dari beberapa ahli dan pelatih yang ada di Indonesia. “Kami akan mendiskusikan hal ini dengan terbuka,” sebut Iriawan.

PSSI Call Indonesian National Team Have New Coach This November
Nov 6 2019, 08:20 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - General Chairman of PSSI, Mochamad Iriawan, ensures that the Indonesian National Team Coach, Simon McMenemy, will be replaced in accordance with the results of the Executive Committee (Exco) meeting. The former Metro Jaya Police Chief said there were still administrative procedures that needed to be passed so that the Scottish coach could be terminated.
"Surely there are procedures or procedures that must be passed," said the man who is familiarly called Iwan Bule at the Sultan Hotel, Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
For a replacement candidate, said Iwan Bule, there are two names that strengthen, namely Luis Milla and South Korean coach, Shin Tae-yong. In addition there are several names of national trainers who are proposed to the management to PSSI. "Later they will only be able to end of November because they are related to the work they already have," he said.
The PSSI Executive Committee decided to replace the Indonesian national team coach, Simon McMenemy. Substitution was delivered directly by the Chairman of PSSI, Mochamad Iriawan, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
"We thank Simon for the cooperation so far. Hopefully the match against Malaysia will get positive results, "he said.
The second match of the Indonesian national team against Malaysia in the 2022 World Cup Qualifiers will be the last match for Simon. The Federation is currently looking for Simon's replacement. The Executive Committee will listen to input from the PSSI Engineering Department.
In addition, the federation will also invite and absorb the aspirations of several experts and trainers in Indonesia. "We will discuss this matter openly," said Iriawan.

IRSYAN HASYIM
